chapter.title: Patron
chapter.para: On the Deliver menu, Patron provides access to users to view and maintain standard Patron E-Docs.

section.title: Deliver Notices
section.para: The Deliver Notices allow users to download pdf versions of Recall, On hold, or Overdue notices. The notices will include Patron information and Title/Item information. Pdfs may be printed and sent or emailed to patrons.
Deliver Notices are stored in a locally configurable location. This location is set by the parameter PDF_LOCATION (OLE-DLVR is the Namespace Code; Parameters can be found on the Admin tab).

On the bottom of some of the notice types, Recalls for one, a link to "My Account" will display. This should be modified to your institution's "My Account" patron service. This link location is set by the parameter MY_ACCOUNT_URL. (OLE-DLVR is the Namespace Code).
Deliver Notices can also be accessed from the Admin tab, below the Batch Processes sub menu, under the link Deliver Batch Job.

section.title: Patron

note.para: Please click here for technical documentation.

section.para: The Patron document is used to create and maintain the contact information of patrons within OLE.

section.title: Getting Started
section.para: Permissions to create and maintain Patron records are given to several roles. Patron Manager has all privileges to modify Patrons and the maintenance documents. Full Circulation Attendant has permission to edit patron records

section.title: Document Layout

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document

section.para: The Patron document includes the Overview, Contacts, Affiliations, Library Policies, Loaned Records, Requested Records, Temporary Circulation History Records, Proxy Patron, Proxy For and Local Identification tabs in addition to the standard tabs that display at the bottom of OLE documents.

note.para: For more information about the standard tabs, see Standard Tabs on the Guide to OLE Basic Functionality and Key Concepts.

section.title: Loaned Records, Requested Records and Temporary Circulation History Tabs
section.para: The Loaned Records, Requested Records, and the Temporary Circulation Historytabs allow you to review items linked to the patron. Each tab includes basic information about a title loaned to the patron as well as the due date. Click View all records to see the patron's loaned or requested items, or the patron's temporary Circulation History Record

note.para: The Temporary Circulation History Records feature allows users to look up items they have checked out in the past. If privacy concerns trump the desire to offer this feature, a library can opt NOT to create a temporary circulation history.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document: Loaned Records, Requested Records, Temporary Circulation History Records Tabs

The Proxy For tab will display the details of the proxied patron. This tab is not editable.

section.title: Lost/Invalid Barcode Info Tab
section.para: A patron’s lost/invalid barcode number is tracked to prevent fraudulent use of lost or stolen ID cards. Users may update a patron’s barcode on the Overview tab. When this has been done, any expired barcodes will appear on the Expired/Updated Barcode tab with an Effective date.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document: Lost/Invalid Barcode Info Tab

section.para: To update a barcode:

listitem.para: Choose Update barcode at the bottom of the Patron record.
In the pop-up window, select a Reason from the dropdown list and add a Description.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document: Deactivate Barcode Pop-up

listitem.para: Click Confirm to update the Patron record.
On the Patron record, enter a new barcode in the Overview tab.

section.title: Patron Bills
section.para: From the Patron search screen, staff may view bills and accept payments from the Patron Bill link or create a bill from the Create Bill link.

note.para: For more information about creating patron bills, see Patron Bill Payment

mediaobject.alt: Patron Lookup: Search Results displays links for Patron Bills

listitem.para: Click Patron Bill to view and accept payments for a patron.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Summary: Available by clicking Patron Bill on the Patron Lookup Search Results

listitem.para: Check the bill from the Bills tab or the line item from the Bills in Detail tab that the patron would like to pay.
Select the Payment Mode from the drop down list if you plan to accept a payment.

Click Accept
to receive a payment.

Click Forgive
to forgive an amount.

Click Error
when the charge was made in error.

section.para: When selecting cancel, error. or forgive, you must enter a note in the pop-up box and click ok. This note has a limit of 500 characters.

listitem.para: At a minimum, a patron MUST have the following data elements: last name, first name, borrower type, delivery privileges, paging privileges, affiliation, department, barcode, address, delivery preference, address verified , address (can be either a mail address, email or text; if a mail address), address source (required for each address of any type), courtesy notice preference
Any attempt to create a patron record without a required field will refresh the display with a message indicating the missing data element.
Expiration dates in a patron's record can be set to null.
If courtesy notices are not used by a library, these will be set to "No". If switched to Yes, these will only be produced when a special batch process is run.

section.title: Patron Bill

para.emphasis:
> Patron Bill
> Patron Bill Lookup
> Patron Bill

section.para: Patron bills for overdue fines and replacement fees are generated automatically by the system through check-in and renewal transactions using information from loan transaction records, calculated based on information from the Circulation Policy Set governing the loan, and sent to patrons using their preferred delivery method. Patron bill information is stored in the system; the formatted bill as delivered to the patron is not. Operators can also manually create patron bills.

note.para: Fine rates and replacement fees will be configured locally. By setting fine rates and replacement fees to null or zero, libraries can opt to NOT automatically create these patron bills.

section.para: You may alternatively access Patron Bills via the Patron search screen.

section.title: Search for a Patron Bill
section.para: From the Deliver tab, under the Patron submenu, click Patron Bill to enter the lookup screen.
Enter the Patron's ID or search for the patron by name.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Lookup Screen

section.para: Click the bill number of the bill you wish to view. A popup box will appear with some information about the bill. Click details to view more information including item and transaction information and notes.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Inquiry Pop-up from the Patron Bill Inquiry Screen

section.title: Create a Patron Bill Manually
section.para: Patron bills for replacement and other fees can also be created manually by duly authorized operators using locally-defined fee types, e.g., rentals, copying, etc. and then be delivered to patrons. To do so, click Create Bill on the Patron search screen.

note.para: To pay a patron bill, you must click Patron Bill from the Patron Lookup Screen. For information about paying the bill, see Patron Bill.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Lookup: Click Create Bill at the far right of the search results

section.para: If you create multiple fees on a patron’s bill, the system calculates the total amount.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Document: Total Amount Tab

listitem.para: An operator can create a bill manually online by charging any fee.

If an item in a check-in transaction is found to be overdue, the system creates an overdue fine patron bill at check-in, using the applicable values in the appropriate Circulation Policy Set. This bill is then delivered automatically to the patron provided the total amount meets the locally-determined threshold amount. Replacement fee bills are generated by a batch program for those items that are overdue and have received a maximum number of overdue notices.
